meanings.definition: A fictional character with superhuman powers or abilities, typically fighting crime or saving the world.
meanings.sent1: Kids love to dress up as superheroes for Halloween.
meanings.sent2: Superheroes often have secret identities to protect their loved ones.
meanings.sent3: The superheroes at the costume party were all trying to outdo each other with their powers.
meanings.sent4: In times of crisis, doctors and nurses become the real superheroes of our society.
meanings.sent5: The city skyline was protected by a team of superheroes, each with a unique power.

meanings.definition: A person who is admired for their courage, outstanding achievements, or noble qualities.
meanings.sent1: My grandfather is my real-life superhero; he always knows how to fix things.
meanings.sent2: Firefighters are often seen as superheroes for their bravery in rescuing people from burning buildings.
meanings.sent3: The little girl thought her mom was a superhero because she could make her feel better with just a hug.
meanings.sent4: Teachers who inspire their students to reach for the stars are the unsung superheroes of education.
meanings.sent5: The community came together to celebrate the local superhero who had saved a drowning child from a river.
